Question
========

In *repeated measures designs*, *counterbalancing* is often used. Why is this done?

Answerlist
----------

* To prevent carryover effects from distorting the results.
* To ensure that carryover effects will occur.
* To check in retrospect whether carryover effects played a role.

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* To avoid carryover effects distorting the results: Correct
* To ensure that carryover effects will occur: Incorrect
* To ensure in retrospect that carryover effects played a role: Incorrect
